title: sleep-debt-tracker
description: sleep-debt-tracker is a project built with TypeScript, JavaScript, CSS, and HTML to help users track and manage their sleep debt. It provides a simple and intuitive interface for logging sleep hours, calculating sleep debt, and visualizing sleep patterns. This repository serves as a practical application of TypeScript in a front-end web development context, focusing on managing and presenting sleep-related data.

title: robofleet-dashboard
description: The robofleet-dashboard repository provides a web-based interface, built with JavaScript, Python, HTML, and CSS, for monitoring and controlling robotic fleets (Robofleet). This project focuses on offering a comprehensive dashboard solution, enabling users to visualize robot status, manage tasks, and gain insights into fleet operations.

title: Map-Visualisation
description: Map-Visualisation is a project showcasing interactive map visualizations built using HTML for the front-end and Python for backend processing or data integration. This repository explores different mapping techniques and libraries to effectively display geographical data and patterns, serving as a demonstration of practical application within the broader "project" topic area.

title: jovian
description: The `jovian` repository is a Python-based CRUD application built with Flask and PostgreSQL, demonstrating fundamental project development principles. It utilizes HTML, CSS, and Shell scripting alongside Python to create a functional web application showcasing best practices for data management, user interaction, and server-side logic. This project serves as a practical example for learning web development and related technologies.

title: next-idea-board
description: Next-idea-board is a web-based project board built with TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, designed to help teams collaboratively organize and manage ideas from conception to implementation. It provides a flexible and visual platform for brainstorming, prioritizing, and tracking the progress of projects, making it easier to bring the next big idea to life.

title: resume
description: This repository houses the source code for my resume, built using LaTeX for professional formatting and potentially incorporating HTML for web display. The project showcases my skills and experience in a visually appealing and easily adaptable format.

title: genietalks
description: GenieTalks is a project built with TypeScript, CSS, JavaScript, HTML, Vite.js, and Express.js that leverages the Gemini API to create an interactive and engaging experience. This repository showcases a modern web application architecture and explores the integration of AI capabilities using the Gemini API, providing a practical example for developers interested in building similar projects.

title: ros-log-viewer
description: ros-log-viewer is a web-based tool for visualizing and analyzing ROS (Robot Operating System) log files. Built with JavaScript, Python, HTML, CSS, and shell scripts, this project provides a user-friendly interface to parse, filter, and display ROS log data, making debugging and understanding ROS-based systems easier. It is a valuable asset for ROS developers looking to improve their workflow.

title: NextJs-Dashboard
description: NextJs-Dashboard is a project showcasing a modern dashboard built with Next.js, leveraging the power of TypeScript for enhanced type safety and maintainability, styled with CSS for a visually appealing interface, and utilizing JavaScript for dynamic functionality. This repository serves as a practical example for learning and implementing dashboard development techniques within the Next.js ecosystem.

title: raven-v2
description: Raven-v2 is a project built using TypeScript and JavaScript, focused on [Insert specific goal or functionality of the project here. Be specific! For example: "creating a robust user authentication system," or "developing a real-time data visualization dashboard"]. This repository contains the codebase and resources necessary for [mention the main task or purpose the code serves], adhering to modern development practices and leveraging the strengths of both TypeScript's type safety and JavaScript's flexibility.

title: devboard
description: Devboard is a project template built with Next.js 14 (using the Pages Router) and TypeScript, leveraging MUI for UI components and React Query for efficient data fetching. This repository serves as a foundation for quickly bootstrapping new web applications, incorporating best practices and modern technologies for a streamlined development experience. It showcases practical implementation of key concepts including TypeScript integration, robust data management with React Query, and a visually appealing interface powered by MUI's component library.

title: dynamic-event-calendar
description: dynamic-event-calendar is a project built using JavaScript, CSS, and HTML to create a dynamic and interactive event calendar. This repository houses the code for a customizable calendar component capable of displaying and managing events with a focus on providing a user-friendly and visually appealing way to organize and schedule activities.

title: iot-asset-tracking
description: This repository is a Next.js-based project implementing an IoT asset tracking system. Built with TypeScript, styled with Tailwind CSS, and utilizing Supabase for backend data management, this project demonstrates a modern web application for monitoring and managing physical assets, showcasing best practices in front-end development and serverless database integration.

title: finance-with-python
description: This repository, built using Jupyter Notebook and Python, contains projects focused on applying Python to financial analysis and modeling. It explores various financial concepts and techniques through practical coding examples, making it a valuable resource for anyone looking to learn or improve their financial skills using Python.

title: atg-world
description: The atg-world repository houses a project built using TypeScript, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS. This project focuses on [briefly describe the project's purpose - e.g., creating an interactive world map, a dynamic web application, or a portfolio website], leveraging these technologies to deliver [mention a key feature or functionality - e.g., a responsive user interface, a data-driven experience, or a visually appealing presentation]. The repository explores concepts related to project development, front-end technologies, and potential backend integration.

title: next-voting
description: Next-voting is a project built using TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, designed to facilitate simple and efficient online voting systems. This repository contains the codebase for a voting application, covering features like user authentication, ballot creation, vote submission, and result tabulation. It explores modern web development practices and provides a foundation for building robust and user-friendly voting platforms.

title: fruit-seller
description: Fruit-Seller is a simple e-commerce project built with Next.js 14 (using the Pages Router), TypeScript, and JavaScript. It utilizes MUI for styling and React Query for efficient data fetching and caching, showcasing a modern type-safe approach to building interactive web applications. The repository serves as a learning resource and project template for those interested in exploring these technologies within the context of an online store.
